## Airbnb in Berlin

- 20,000+ Berliners have hosted travelers via Airbnb in 2015 [@Airbnb:2015aa]. 

- And more than half a million guests.

- *Rents and Zweckentfremdungsverbot:* Schafer et al found that 5,555 residential apartments in Berlin are currently being misused for Airbnb.

## Previous Research

- Effect on rents: 

- *But What About The Hotel Industry?* Guttentag estimates that Airbnb sold about 15 million room nights in 2012. Similar to that of Fairfield Inn & Suites or InterContinental, two major hotel brands.

- *Airbnb Messes with Texas:* Zervas et al. found that a 10 percent size increase of the Airbnb market in Texas resulted in a .39 percent decrease in hotel revenue.

- Our paper contributes to this white spot in literature.

## Hypotheses

- *H1:* The higher the Airbnb supply in a given district in Berlin, the greater the negative effect on the hotel industry in that same district.

- *H2:* The Airbnb effect is likely the strongest once it has reached an undefined critical mass.

## Building the Model

In order to test our hypotheses, we will employ several models

> (2) Fixed Effects with Income and Unemployment as Economic Control Variables
${\log overnights}_{it} = \beta _i * \log Abb_{it} + \tau _i + \beta _j * X' + \varepsilon _{it}$

> (3) Fixed Effects with Income, Unemployment, and a Neighborhood Specific Time Trend
${\log overnights}_{it} = \beta _i * \log Abb_{it} + \tau _i + \beta _j * X' + \varepsilon _{it}$

> (4) Uses Hotel Occupancy Rate as the Dependent Variable & Introduces an Airbnb Interaction Term. 
${OccupRate}_{it} = \beta _i * \log Abb_{it} + \tau _i + \beta _j * X' + \varepsilon _{it}$
